TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed PersistenceMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies how an ASP.NET server control property or event is persisted declaratively in an .aspx or .ascx file.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates an <xref:System.Web.UI.ITemplate> property that will be persisted as an inner property, as defined by applying the ttribute attribute to the property's metadata.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.persiste_1_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.persiste_1_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode Attribute = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property or event persists as an attribute.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode EncodedInnerDefaultProperty = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property persists as the only inner text of the ASP.NET server control. The property value is HTML encoded. Only a string can be given this designation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode InnerDefaultProperty = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property persists in the ASP.NET server control as inner text. Also indicates that this property is defined as the element's default property. Only one property can be designated the default property.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.PersistenceMode InnerProperty = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property persists in the ASP.NET server control as a nested tag. This is commonly used for complex objects, those that have persistable properties of their own.
